intro: Cheiranthus menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' rocket, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, cruciform flowers that are typically white or pale purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain seeds. Cheiranthus menziesii thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
